lead_paragraph: The seven-day curfew that requires residents to stay off the streets from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. is a potential economic disaster for local business owners that rely on nighttime customers.

headline.print_headline: Empty Streets New Threat to Businesses in Baltimore
headline.main: Empty Streets New Threat to Businesses in Baltimore

snippet: The seven-day curfew that requires residents to stay off the streets from 10 p.m. to 5 a.m. is a potential economic disaster for local business owners that rely on nighttime customers.
abstract: Seven-day curfew in Baltimore is potentially devastating to local business owners who rely on nighttime customers; owners report that some customers are canceling or rescheduling appointments, leading to further lost income; curfew was imposed after demonstrations and riots following funeral of black man Freddie Gray, who died while in police custody.
